reviewText:
I'm not sure if this game was meant to be a rage game or if I'm just bad at the game.
I got stuck 2 minutes into the jump tutorial but then figured it out
Despite it's really difficult nature, it's actually a pretty good game
Could do better using the full screen rather than just a few areas of the screen for some stages, however.

reviewText:
Without a doubt. The most broken, frustrating, unsatisfying experience I have had in a LONG time.

Horribly clunky unresponsive, glitchy movement. Luck based pointless spamfest fighting". Absolutely no story to speak of whatsoever.

All you do is go through an ambiguously stereotypically asian city filled with spikes
date: rolling barrels that spawn literally out of thin air
recommended: bullets that literally spawn out of thin air
hoursPlayed: and ambiguously stereotypically asian enemies. You beat them all up in exactly the same fashion
voteText: none of them act differently other than slightly different barebones animations
helpfulPercent: even the "bosses" are exactly the same as the mooks
votesHelpful: except with more health and a unique sprite.\nOnce you beat the last "boss" the game cuts to a black screen with "...a good workout" or something like that
votesTotal:
and then your booted to the title screen.

Also did I mention that there is NO way of saving progress in any way. You quit? You start over. Your PC died suddenly? You start over.

Many MANY times I have been killed because the game just did not read my inputs
votesFunny: or straight up did the wrong thing
column16: and sometimes the game just sends you flying upwards forever when you jump up a ledge (thankfully there is a reset checkpoint button)
column17: and the collision detection is extremely random
column18: something that would normally kill me doesn't
column19:
and vice versa.

The last level (Level 5) is absolutely disgusting and highlights all of the game's problems I mentioned previously. As well as stupidly long rooms.

The soundtrack is decent at best. But writing this review after beating it
column20: I don't remember any of it already.\n\nOverall I can't recommend this to anyone wanting to actually have fun. AVOID."

reviewText:
Alright, I cant do it. The controls are too stiff...mostly the jumping and such. The fighting worked fine and what have you, but man that jumping and those stupid three second timed spikes...which would normally be okay if the jumping mechanic was smooth instead of choppy and erratic and stiff. Comtroller or K/M isnt relevant. It was the same with both.
I wish that one aspect of the game was improved becaquse I would undoubtedly finish it if it was, but cant do it and wont do it. Retired.

p.s. The music is catchy although I imagine it would get repetetive after a while and the game looks like an old school arcade game which is pretty cool. But yeah....

reviewText:
Played 5 mins, paused, played 18 more mins, had to stop to write this review.

You play as Dag, a jump/boxer who lives in an Asian town where gravity only applies to you. Being discriminated against for his choice in clothing, you parkour your way through the city, battling stereotypically dressed Asian thugs, my favorite of which, is an 8-bit, half dressed, ♥♥♥♥ covered knock off of Liu Kang. As you mash away at the fight button, you pray you wont be defeated, since there is no indication as to when you may be bested. When not battling, you are avoiding spikes, and what look to be ethereal blades that spawn randomly (or are they bullets, no one knows.)

The controls are the most unresponsive I've ever encountered, which resulted in a lot of face first jumps into walls, followed by continual walking in the opposite direction.

Laughed the whole time, thoroughly enjoyed it. I may throw a $50 down and gift it to everyone on my friends list.

10/10, can't wait for Jump/Shooter
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
IT’S SO ♥♥♥♥ING DIFFICULT!!! MORE PLEASE!!!
Well, the thing is its too ♥♥♥♥ing frustrating. The enemies have no real rhyme or reason to their attack patterns, and there are spikes ♥♥♥♥ing everywhere. The game is a death trap and don’t blame your audience for not being hard core gamers that transcend the PC gaming master race/class. We tenacious types are hard to come by these days.

the best part is, the game actually has realistic controls and free running physics for the main character. The last game was better flowing with freeform puff jumping and more open environments to explore and enemy attack patterns that made sense, sure the combat got old, but the very first game was about the combat, second game wacko bananas ninja jumps, this one combines realistic jumps with fantasy spikes and trash cans and Chinese warriors from out of nowhere.

The death trap environments, along with the true-to-life(ish) actions of the character make platforming a pixel nightmare, and a real test of patience.

I feel that the game could have had a better challenge curve, but i suppose its fine as is. all the same, don’t expect as many people to have the patience that i had.

Also, if anyone cares to notice, I’ve been referring to these games as a series, and that’s because I feel they may all be the same story

*spoilers for Samurai_Jazz*
In the first 2 you're the same guy. At the end of 1 you get to (either) lay your masters soul to rest after he commits suicide at the beginning and (or) fight a dark reflection of yourself that stabs you in the back anyway, but that could have been all in your mind and it’s supposed to make you think of honor vs. all of the killing you did to get there...

*spoilers for Shin Samurai Jazz*
Flash forward a few years and you're (either) dead and (or) a ninja, and back in the city where your master died and there’s a gang of undead thugs still running the place. You fight the yakuza style 1920s/30s gangs and demons in the first game, now followed by 3 spirits. You take down the last gang the three spirits take over the world instead, and finally you conquer them in the name of humanity or something. The spirits basically loose all power and as a last hearty FU to the Ronin"
date:
they cut the bleeding earth in half!

*Spoilers for Jump Boxer*
The game starts and you look like some hobo that’s fighting at shadows. But after a few sections
recommended: I started passing by graffiti that was a tribute to the "Ronin".\nmy guess is
voteText: Ronin moved into a city where the earth was stable (or he managed to fix the earth somehow)
votesHelpful: and now as a senile old man
votesTotal: he free-runs around the inner city
votesFunny: and he's either shadow boxing his hallucinations or he's continually haunted by the spirits of dead warriors for being the one responsible for Japanese demons ♥♥♥♥ing up the earth... It’s not bad
column16: when the final boss looks like Bruce Lee

reviewText:
Abysmal in every sense of the word. Absolutely atrocious. One of the worst games I've ever played.

The platforming controls are stiff and basically broken. The wall jump is the worst I've ever seen, all jump arcs are fixed, you can't move to the side when jumping straight up. Sometimes you don't quite grab a ledge and cling to the wall instead, only to fall, presumably to your death. Spikes are instant death and reeeally shouldn't be, especially since there are a few occasions of basically impossible jumps being required (one at the end of a relatively long, boring level, too, you did not playtest this game, did you, dev?)

The combat is pointless. It's slow, can be won by spamming punches and holdind guard, and there's way too much of it. It destroys any chance of pacing this game could've had. All it does is waste my time between platforming sections. I think I died to enemies maybe twice in an hour of playing, and one of those was a boss.

So there is nothing salvageable here, nothing original, nothing worth your time or money. Avoid like the plague.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game brings memories of finding an old nes game that you didn't remember playing and lost the manual to. This game seems to emulate almost all negative aspects of old console games, fighting is bland, you can do a punch, a low kick or a high kick that do practically the same and no enemies require specific strategies. Movement is clunky and unresponsive but that almost feels like design choince.
I honestly tried to give this game a fair chance, i gave up on third level where a fairly tricky timing based spike jumping section that started with a fist-sponge enemy, that i had to kill every time i failed, and i failed a lot because of the controls, that made is almost impossible to jump forwards from a standstill.
There is no plot that i saw, no feeling of acomplishment after beating 'bosees?' that were just enemies with more hp to make me try to play more.
Maybe there is something I'm completely missing but the only positive thing is can say is that most of the pixel art is nice, but not amazing. I see no reason to recommend this, sadly.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText: From start to finish this was a entertaining game through and through. There are 5 levels and each one requires some pretty good platforming skills to get through them. The fighting in this game isn't really anything to praise. It has its punches and high and low kicks with blocking which the AI can be tricky to get past. You could try to be technical to beat enemies, but there really isn't anything stopping you from trying your luck with button mashing the attack button.\n\nThere aren't that many differences in the common enemy, but the bosses in each stage has some unique looks to them. While the fighting isn't really anything special, the real reason to play this game is for the platforming. The platforming parts require good precision with your button presses and good reaction times. Its got a good difficulty set so you you'll get kick out of this game. The game might be short, but for a buck(79 cents for me on sale) you get a great challenge  that gives you an old school like feel.

reviewText:
this game had some potential but just is not really there.

The jumping and movement were not great but were decent enough in my opinion

The problem is the other half of the game-the fighting is....well...boring as ♥♥♥♥. it seems like it could have been good but once you find out there are no real combos, no stamina bar and stupid A.I you soon figure out the ideal way to fight enemies is button mashing. this actually might not have been so bad if you could skip it by jumping over them or something but you can't there isn't even a jump kick.

reviewText:
It's a real homage to the 80s plattformer.
This dev took the aesthetics of the time very seriously and did not mantle 8bit wannabe graphics with too many layers of background and such.
This is very close to the real 8 bit limitations of the time.
Also the level and platform design resemble the early home computer plattformer of the time.
A time where they made games hard as balls of steel, because for the first time in computer gaming history you did not have to put quaters in to keep on playing.

reviewText:
Paid 79 cents on sale, definately got 79 cents worth of entertainment out of it. Jumping puzzels are unforgiving and the game has a tendancy to jump straight up when you're trying to jump forward or fall while you're trying to double jump. Not sure if it's supposed to be high difficulty or if the code just needs to be tweaked a bit.
Fighting was a bit of a letdown. Like so many of the titles of the era it's trying to emulate, spamming low kick will beat most fights easily.

BUT, hey it was fun for a little bit, the visuals were bright and had a Jet set radio" feel to them. Characters had a little personality to them. I think I would have been diappointed had I paid $5

reviewText:
JUMP BOXER.....

Tengo los sentimientos encontrados con este juego.
permitanme explicar:

es un juego que toma ideas del original prince of persia, double dragon (snes), y una idea basica de parkour lo coloca en la licuadora y boom, sale jump boxer. demuestra sus origenes independentes en la animacion ya que es en 8 bit y la transicion de una pantalla a otra no es simultanea mostrando, en algunos ecenarios solo una franja con el motivo de acentuar la accion presentada en esta representacion de un ghetto asiatico. la musica esta bien  y es acorde con la dinamica del juego con tonadas pegajosas. sin embargo el nivel de dificultad es lo que hace brillar el juego y no precisamente por razones correctas. la mayor de las ofensas es el control. para haber sido un juego que se creo en el 2013 los controles son bastante imprecisos en el momento de saltar haciendo el parkour una experiencia poco placentera, frustrante y agotadora. les mencione que tomaba ideas de doble dragon? si,  por es un side scroller beat them up, lastimosamente uno bastante repetitivo ya que es tan sencillo como estar bien cerca del oponente y darle duro al boton x hasta que desaparesca de la pantalla. Sin embargo el esquema planteado es algo complejo ya que tiene patadas y bloqueos  dando la idea de que pudo haber sido algo mas.  siguiendo con el tema, la gran y maravillosa inteligencia artificial que funciona cuando se le da la gana como vaca que va al matadero. bastante pasiva y poco inspirada por que cuando no es mr sensei de karate es mr de muay thai y si no es la señora de los tintos con la cual hay que pelear que acorralados en una esquina su paliza recibiran, a exepcion de lo jefes que tienen vestimentas diferentes pero pasivos como cacto en el desierto.

apesar de lo mencionado previamente el juego tiene sus momentos y es extremadamente barato, asi que pueden considerar esta como una recomendacion si la dificultad de super meat boy no los ha saceado y buscan algo en que pasar el tiempo y no han liberado su copia de batman de las masmorras de wb.

reviewText:
This is a 2d platform 8bit style video game.

This could be a game you play on your old NES 8 bit system.
You have 2 action buttons ... jump and fight button.
It's extreme difficoult  to plat and you really nee to get used to the controlers.
Jumping from platform to platform can be freaking annoying because you need to do it right.
Every stage is a check point... if you die and fail you start right over.

It's a great game and gives you a really good retro feeling.
There is so no depth in the game and gets boring after some while.

I give it a 6/10 score.

reviewText: I think I paid like a quarter for this game. Not worth a dollar. But a quarter? Sure. The game has a recurring bug involving hitting a ledge at a certain angle and you go flying up, waiting a long time to fall down. Takes a while to learn the mechanics so it makes you feel like you've learned something. But the fighting is completely useless. I don't even know why it was implemented.
